Covariance
double Covariance(
std::vector<double> &xdata,
std::vector<double> &ydata,
bool useSampleVariance
)

Returns the covariance (-1, 0, +1) for a given set of data The covariance measure the linear relationship between a set of data.  If the data moves together than it is positive. If it moves in opposite direction than it is negative. If it moves in uncorrelated directions it is 0.

Parameters
xdata
std::vector<double>&

x values

ydata
std::vector<double>&

y values

useSampleVariance
bool

indicates whether to compute the sample or population variance

CircumCircle
extern void CircumCircle(
Vector2 &p0,
Vector2 &p1,
Vector2 &p2,
Vector2 *pCircumCenter,
float *pRadius
)

Given 3 points of a triangle this function will compute the center and radius of the circle passing through those points

Parameters
p0
Vector2&

first point on circle

p1
Vector2&

second point on circle

p2
Vector2&

third point on circle

pCircumCenter
Vector2*

returns the center of the circumcircle

pRadius
float*

returns the radius of the circumcircle

Vector2 &p0,
Vector2 &p1,
Vector2 &p2,
Vector2 &pt
)

Tests if a point is inside the specified circumcircle

Parameters
p0
Vector2&

first point on circle

p1
Vector2&

second point on circle

p2
Vector2&

third point on circle

pt
Vector2&

Point to test

Returns

True if point is in circumcircle. False otherwise.
